/* Name: define-item-id-change-procedure.sql Purpose: migrate the id of an item to match the commonly agreed upon definition. Created: 7-JAN-2005 George J. Carrette */ create procedure item_id_change(@itemtype_name varchar(32), @existing_id char(32), @new_id char(32)) AS BEGIN DECLARE @ITEMTYPE_ID_SET TABLE(ID CHAR(32)) DECLARE @TBL_NAMES TABLE(TBL_NAME VARCHAR(64)) DECLARE @TBL_COLS TABLE(TBL_NAME VARCHAR(64),COL_NAME VARCHAR(64)) DECLARE @TBL_NAME VARCHAR(64) DECLARE @COL_NAME VARCHAR(64) DECLARE @TBL_COLS_CHANGED TABLE(TBL_NAME VARCHAR(64),COL_NAME VARCHAR(64),CHANGE_COUNT INTEGER)
INSERT INTO @ITEMTYPE_ID_SET SELECT ID FROM ITEMTYPE WHERE NAME = @itemtype_name while @@rowcount > 0 insert into @itemtype_id_set select source_id from morphae where related_id in (select id from @itemtype_id_set) and not source_id in (select id from @itemtype_id_set)
INSERT INTO @TBL_NAMES SELECT INSTANCE_DATA FROM ITEMTYPE WHERE EXISTS (SELECT NAME FROM SYSOBJECTS WHERE NAME = ITEMTYPE.INSTANCE_DATA AND TYPE = 'U ') INSERT INTO @TBL_COLS SELECT ITEMTYPE.INSTANCE_DATA,PROPERTY.NAME FROM ITEMTYPE,PROPERTY WHERE ITEMTYPE.INSTANCE_DATA IN (SELECT TBL_NAME FROM @TBL_NAMES) AND ITEMTYPE.ID = PROPERTY.SOURCE_ID AND PROPERTY.DATA_TYPE = 'Item' AND PROPERTY.DATA_SOURCE IN (SELECT ID FROM @ITEMTYPE_ID_SET) INSERT INTO @TBL_COLS select (select instance_data from itemtype where id = property.source_id),name from property where data_type = 'Item' and data_source is null and name = 'source_id'
DECLARE @WORKPTR CURSOR SET @WORKPTR = CURSOR FOR SELECT TBL_NAME,COL_NAME FROM @TBL_COLS OPEN @WORKPTR FETCH NEXT FROM @WORKPTR INTO @TBL_NAME, @COL_NAME WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0 BEGIN DECLARE @SQL NVARCHAR(256) DECLARE @DCL NVARCHAR(256) SET @SQL = 'UPDATE [' + @TBL_NAME + '] SET ' + @COL_NAME + ' = @NEW_ID ' + ' WHERE ' + @COL_NAME + ' = @EXISTING_ID' SET @DCL = '@EXISTING_ID CHAR(32),@NEW_ID CHAR(32)' execute sp_executesql @SQL,@DCL,@EXISTING_ID=@EXISTING_ID,@NEW_ID=@NEW_ID INSERT INTO @TBL_COLS_CHANGED (TBL_NAME,COL_NAME,CHANGE_COUNT) VALUES (@TBL_NAME,@COL_NAME,@@rowcount) FETCH NEXT FROM @WORKPTR INTO @TBL_NAME, @COL_NAME END CLOSE @WORKPTR SELECT * FROM @TBL_COLS_CHANGED END
